segment.source: Inf2Cat Properties for Driver Package Projects
segment.target: Inf2Cat Properties for Driver Package Projects

segment.source: Sets the properties for the Inf2Cat tool.
segment.target: Sets the properties for the Inf2Cat tool.

segment.source: The Inf2Cat tool can be used to create catalog files for any driver package that has an INF file.
segment.target: The Inf2Cat tool can be used to create catalog files for any driver package that has an INF file.

segment.source: Setting Inf2Cat properties for driver package projects
segment.target: Setting Inf2Cat properties for driver package projects

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver package.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver package.

segment.source: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties and then click Inf2Cat.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties and then click Inf2Cat.

segment.source: Select the Run Inf2Cat option.
segment.target: Select the Run Inf2Cat option.

segment.source: This option runs the Inf2Cat tool on any INF files in the project (for example, .inf, .inx, or .inv files).
segment.target: This option runs the Inf2Cat tool on any INF files in the project (for example, .inf, .inx, or .inv files).

segment.source: If the driver package is installed by using an INF file, use the Inf2Cat tool to create the catalog file.
segment.target: If the driver package is installed by using an INF file, use the Inf2Cat tool to create the catalog file.

segment.source: Inf2Cat validates that files referenced in the INF file are present in the package.
segment.target: Inf2Cat validates that files referenced in the INF file are present in the package.

segment.source: To add files to the package, use the property pages for the package project and driver project.
segment.target: To add files to the package, use the property pages for the package project and driver project.

segment.source: See Creating a Driver Package for more information.
segment.target: See Creating a Driver Package for more information.

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Run Inf2Cat
segment.target: Run Inf2Cat

segment.source: Runs the Inf2Cat tool on any INF files in the project (for example, .inf, .inx, or .inv files).
segment.target: Runs the Inf2Cat tool on any INF files in the project (for example, .inf, .inx, or .inv files).

segment.source: Windows Version List
segment.target: Windows Version List

segment.source: Specifies a list of Windows versions supported by the .inf file.
segment.target: Specifies a list of Windows versions supported by the .inf file.

segment.source: Separate each Windows version with a comma.
segment.target: Separate each Windows version with a comma.

segment.source: The default setting is $(Inf2CatWindowsVersionList), a macro that builds the driver for the active platform and configuration.
segment.target: The default setting is $(Inf2CatWindowsVersionList), a macro that builds the driver for the active platform and configuration.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /os:WindowsVersionList.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /os:WindowsVersionList.

segment.source: Include Page Hashes
segment.target: Include Page Hashes

segment.source: Include page hashes with files.
segment.target: Include page hashes with files.

segment.source: Optionally followed by a list of files.
segment.target: Optionally followed by a list of files.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /pageHashes[:file1][,file2]...].
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /pageHashes[:file1][,file2]...].

segment.source: Add PE Attribute
segment.target: Add PE Attribute

segment.source: Adds a PE catalog attribute to files.
segment.target: Adds a PE catalog attribute to files.

segment.source: Optionally followed by a list of files.
segment.target: Optionally followed by a list of files.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /pe[:file1[,file2]...].
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /pe[:file1[,file2]...].

segment.source: Add Drm
segment.target: Add Drm

segment.source: Adds a DRM-level catalog attribute to files.
segment.target: Adds a DRM-level catalog attribute to files.

segment.source: Optionally followed by a list of files.
segment.target: Optionally followed by a list of files.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /drm[:file1[,file2]...].
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /drm[:file1[,file2]...].

segment.source: Verbose
segment.target: Verbose

segment.source: Displays detailed information about tool output in the Visual Studio Output window.
segment.target: Displays detailed information about tool output in the Visual Studio Output window.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /verbose.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /verbose.

segment.source: No Catalog
segment.target: No Catalog

segment.source: Prevents the creation of any catalog files.
segment.target: Prevents the creation of any catalog files.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /nocat.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /nocat.

segment.source: Use Local Time
segment.target: Use Local Time

segment.source: Use the local time zone while verifying the INF DriverVer Directive directive.
segment.target: Use the local time zone while verifying the INF DriverVer Directive directive.

segment.source: By default UTC, is used.
segment.target: By default UTC, is used.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /uselocaltime.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Inf2Cat option /uselocaltime.

segment.source: For more information about the Inf2Cat tool, see Using Inf2Cat to Create a Catalog File.
segment.target: For more information about the Inf2Cat tool, see Using Inf2Cat to Create a Catalog File.

segment.source: For information about property pages and projects, see the WDK and Visual Studio build environment.
segment.target: For information about property pages and projects, see the WDK and Visual Studio build environment.
